page.title: 01General Description Of Area
page.content: This block is situated on the west coast of Kintyre, reached by a single_track road from the A83 joining Glasgow and Campbeltown. It is approx. 10 miles from Lochgilphead the main centre of the area. Two small townships, Achahoish and Ormsary owned by 2 separate landlords are combined in the block. To the N.W. is a sandy estuary at the head of Loch Caolisport, a sea_loch. The land rises from sea level to 900 feet at the S.E. corner and is mainly sheep_grazing, although a fair proportion is woodland. Population is sparse, the people being employed on both estates in agriculture, horticulture, forestry and a fish_farm. There are holiday homes and chalets on both estates which are very popular with tourists.
